column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Somali alphabet, called alef and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The twenty-third letter of the Somali alphabet, called a and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The second letter of the Somali alphabet, called ba and written in the Latin script.

name
  1. An administrative division in the Doollo Zone of Ogadenia which is settled by reer darawiish.

character
  1. The twelfth letter of the Somali alphabet, called cayn and written in the Latin script.

name
  1. A reer darawiish region between Nugaal and Haud that was historically part of the Dhulbahante garaadship and then its successor state Darwiish.

character
  1. The seventh letter of the Somali alphabet, called deel and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The eleventh letter of the Somali alphabet, called dha and written in the Latin script.

name
  1. (history) The Dhulbahante anti-colonial state established by the xarunta (haroun) that existed between 1895 C.E. and 1920 C.E. corresponding with modern-day Khaatumo; the successor state to the treatyless Dhulbahante garadship led by Sayyidka founded in Dareema Caddo.

name
  1. A kingdom from 1896 to 1921 and successor state to the Dhulbahante garaadship centered in the Nugaal valley.

noun
  1. An affiliate or inhabitant of Darwiish or Darwiishia.
  2. An epithet for the Dhulbahante due to them historically being the primary backbone of the Darwiish.

name
  1. A historical region centered in Cayn, Sool and Haylaan in the former territories of Darwiish or its predecessor states of Dhulbahante garaadship and Warsangeli sultanate.

name
  1. A historical region centered in Cayn, Sool and Haylaan in the former territories of the Dhulbahante garaadship and Warsangeli sultanate and the successor state of Darwiish.

character
  1. The twenty-fourth letter of the Somali alphabet, called e and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The fourteenth letter of the Somali alphabet, called fa and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The thirteenth letter of the Somali alphabet, called ga and written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. A bodyguard of the khusuusi and Sayyid

character
  1. The twenty-first letter of the Somali alphabet, called ha and written in the Latin script.

name
  1. (metonymically, idiomatic) The Somali government from 1969 until 1991.

character
  1. The twenty-fifth letter of the Somali alphabet, called i and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The fourth letter of the Somali alphabet, called ja and written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. A native or inhabitant of Jubaland regional state.
  2. A native or inhabitant of the British Jubaland province.

character
  1. The sixteenth letter of the Somali alphabet, called kaaf and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The sixth letter of the Somali alphabet, called kha and written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. A Darwiishian or Darwiishi.
  2. An inhabitant or native of the Sool, Cayn or the Fiqifuliye district, a region that was historically part of the Dhulbahante garaadship and its successor state of Darwiish.

character
  1. The seventeenth letter of the Somali alphabet, called laan and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The eighteenth letter of the Somali alphabet, called miim and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The nineteenth letter of the Somali alphabet, called nun and written in the Latin script.

intj
  1. Naxariis iyo Nabadgelyo Korkiisa Ha Ahaato (peace be upon him)

column1: Naxariis iyo Nabadgelyo Korkiisa Ha Ahaato

column2:
character
  1. The twenty-sixth letter of the Somali alphabet, called o and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The fifteenth letter of the Somali alphabet, called qaaf and written in the Latin script.

name
  1. Originally the ruling government of the Darwiish and subsequently the government of other administrations in the Sool, Cayn and Haylaan regions.

character
  1. The eighth letter of the Somali alphabet, called ra and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The ninth letter of the Somali alphabet, called sa and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The tenth letter of the Somali alphabet, called shiin and written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. (history) The title of the head of state of Darawiish (circa 1895 - 1920), the Dhulbahante anti-colonial polity geographically corresponding to modern-day Khaatumo.

noun
  1. (history, colloquial) An epithet of the reer darwiish (Siciid Harti), whom predominate in Sool, Cayn, the Fiqifuliye district and Bookh district

noun
  1. Reer Darwiish; a clan which predominates in Sool, Cayn, the Fiqifuliye district and Bookh district.

name
  1. A reer darawiish region that encircles the Nugaal valley that was historically part of the Dhulbahante garaadship and then its successor state Darwiish.

character
  1. The third letter of the Somali alphabet, called ta and written in the Latin script.

name
  1. Tadjoura (a town in Djibouti)
  2. Tadjourah (a region of Djibouti)

character
  1. The twenty-seventh letter of the Somali alphabet, called u and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The twentieth letter of the Somali alphabet, called waw and written in the Latin script.

character
  1. The fifth letter of the Somali alphabet, called xa and written in the Latin script.

name
  1. French Somali Coast Protectorate (pre-1967); present-day Djibouti
  2. British Somali Coast Protectorate (pre-1920 RAF air raids on the Darwiish capitals of Jidali and Taleh); later British Somaliland Protectorate

character
  1. The twenty-second letter of the Somali alphabet, called ya and written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. A promoter of animosity, especially in the form of poetry

noun
  1. A promoter of sobriety, especially in the form of poetry.

verb
  1. to get out (sometimes used as an interjectional exclamation)

intj
  1. by God's mercy, with God's help (an expression of shock)

noun
  1. book (collection of sheets of paper bound together containing printed or written material)

character
  1. The twelfth letter of the Somali alphabet, called cayn and written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. The name of the Latin-script letter C.

noun
  1. stooge
  2. (historically) a native opponent of the Darwiish

noun
  1. The ideology that seeks to preserve the heritage and legacy of Darwiish and predecessor states such as the Dhulbahante garaadship and Warsangeli sultanate.

character
  1. The eleventh letter of the Somali alphabet, written in the Latin script.

verb
  1. to give birth; to procreate; to reproduce

noun
  1. (history) Epithet for the reer darawiish (Siciid Harti).
  2. (history) A Horn African who wears a white turban, especially as a serviceperson.

noun
  1. A Somali wedding celebration where the groom and bride are brought to their new dwelling.

noun
  1. (informal) Field marshal or general of the army
  2. shield

noun
  1. (informal, rare) Field marshal or general of the army

noun
  1. Uncle Tom
  2. An idoor opponent of the Darwiish

character
  1. The sixth letter of the Somali alphabet, called kha and written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. book (especially in Muslim contexts, such as when referring to the Qur'an)

verb
  1. to go through water
  2. be full of water

noun
  1. water that accumulates in a well
  2. well, fountain (water coming from the ground of the well)
  3. gush of water
  4. flow

verb
  1. to expand; to produce; to create
  2. make ooze (out)
  3. let water calm so mud gets to the ground

intj
  1. indicating their reaction at new information, analogous to Really?

intj
  1. (offensive) An exclamation to get attention from a girl.

noun
  1. A government administration in the Sool, Cayn or Haylaan region.

noun
  1. (history, colloquial) The Siciid Harti, whom predominate in Sool, Cayn, the Fiqifuliye district and Bookh district

noun
  1. (history, colloquial) The Siciid Harti, whom predominate in Sool, Cayn, the Fiqifuliye district and Bookh district

noun
  1. (history, colloquial) A clan which predominates in Sool, Cayn, the Fiqifuliye district and Bookh district; the Siciid Harti

noun
  1. namesake (one who is named after another)
  2. namesake (one who shares a name with another)

character
  1. The tenth letter of the Somali alphabet, called shiin and written in the Latin script.

particle
  1. Topic marker which draws attention to the verb.

intj
  1. An exclamation to get attention from a boy.

noun
  1. The name of the Latin-script letter X.

noun
  1. The government of a post-medieval Horn African state, particularly the Daraawiish.

noun
  1. (by extension) The leading figures of the Daraawiish (i.e. commanders, governors, representatives, judges etc.) considered collectively.
  2. (idiomatic, by extension) The Daraawiish government.
